ab.title: Exodus 23
ab.l: You shall not accept a false news. You shall not put your hand with the wicked to bea false witness.
You shall not follow many to do evil. Andyou shall not testify about a dispute following many to rejectjudgment.
And you shall not worship a poor in his lawsuit.
If you meet your enemy’s bull or his donkey going astray,you shall bring it back to him.
If you see a donkeyof your enemy lying under its burden, you shall refrain from the thoughtthat you would not want to help him: you shall help with him.
You shall not reject the judgement of your poor in his verdict.
Keep far from a false word, do not kill the guiltless and righteous, becauseI will not justify the wicked.
And you shall take no bribe, because the bribeblinds the clear-sighted and distorts the wordsof the righteous.
And you shall not oppress a stranger, either.And you know the heart of a stranger, because you were strangers in the landof Egypt.
And six years you shall sow your land andgather its produce.

And the seventh yearyou shall let it lie fallow and stop working on it, andthe poor of your people shall eat, and what they leave the animal of the field shall eat.Thus shall you do to your vineyard, and to your olives.
Six daysyou shall do your work, and on the seventh day you shall rest, so thatyour bull and your donkey may rest, and so thatthe son of your maidservant and even the stranger may rest.
And pay attention in all things thatI have said to you, and make no mention of the name of other gods.Let it not be heard on your mouth.
You shall keep a feastto me three times in the year.

You shall keep the feast of unleavened bread.You shall eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded you, in the appointed timeof the month Baš Qusqan, because then you came out from Egypt. Andnone shall appear before my directions empty.

And the feastof harvest, of the ripening of your work, which you have sown in the field.And the feast of ingathering, which is when the year leaves, when you have gatheredwhat you have done from the field.
Three timesin the year all your males shall appear before the directions of the lord: the Lord.
You shall not sacrifice the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread.And the fat of my feast shall not stay overnight until the morning.
You shall bring the firstof the ripening of your land to the house of the Lord your God.You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
Lo, I sendan angel before you, to keep you in the way, and to bring youto the place which I have prepared.
Be watchful in front of him,and obey his voice. Do not betray him, because he will not pardon your trespasses,because my name is in him, too.
Because if youobey his voice, and do all that I speak, thenI will be an enemy to your enemies, and an oppressor to your oppressors.
Because my Angel will go before you andwill bring you to the Amorites and the Hittites and the Perizzitesand the Canaanites the Hivites and the Jebusites, andI will cut them off.
You shall not bow down to their gods, and you shall not servethem, and you shall not do like the things they do, but you shall smashthem and break down completely their pillars.
And you will serve the Lord your God, andhe will bless your bread and your water, and I will takesickness away from the midst of you.
There will be no miscarrying orbarren woman in your land, I will fulfil your days.
I will send my fear ahead of you, and I will stirall the people to whom you shall come, and I will giveall your enemies to you by the back of their head.
And I will sendthe hornet ahead of you, and it will drive out the Hivite andthe Canaanite and the Hittite from before you.
I will not drive them out from before you in one year, lest the land become desolate,and the animals of the field multiply against you.
Littleby little I will drive them out from before you, until you hall spread and inheritthe land.

And I will set your borderfrom the Red Sea even to the sea of the Philistines, and fromthe wilderness to the river, because I will put the inhabitantsof the land in your hand, and you shall drive them out from before you.
You shall not make a covenant with them and with their gods.
They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against me, becauseif you serve their gods, it will be a snare to you.’
